attributes.action: Remove Total Dog Ban Off All Beaches in Wales THE DOGS ACT 1990 Civil liberties
attributes.additional_details:
I Believe Set Boundary's Should Be In Place For The Public To Enjoy Without Dogs . Areas Would Be Better Controlled In A Cordoned Off Area ,Much Like Areas Life Guards Cover With The Use Of Flags During Peak Season . As Its Easier To Observe The Area Cornered Off.
To Ban Dogs On 82 Beaches Impedes My Rights To Roam On Crown Land .Land What Generations Have Left To You . 
Blanket Punishment For Dog Owners is  Wrong & Unfair To Owner & Pet.Regardless What Animals Are Permitted On Beaches
attributes.background:
I Believe My Civil Liberties Have Been Taken Off Me & Other Dog Owner's To Walk a Dog On a Beach or Crown Land With Or Without a Lead.If Other Animals Can Be Used such like Horses 
& Donkeys .I Believe This Contradicts The Dogs Act 1990.I Have Used The Beach All My Life And Had Dogs By My Side

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to ban dogs from a beach is the responsibility of the relevant local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
